Class ec.cosm.costume.Presentation 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.cosm.costume.Presentation 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.cosm.costume.Presentation
public class Presentation
extends Object
This class encapsulates the information needed to draw an avatar or other structured object at a given position. It contains the methods that generate ready-to-draw lists of art elements and registration points.

anchorPoint
Name of registration point from which avatar is aligned with its background, and point in background on which to align this registration point in avatar.
anchorSegment
Name of segment containing anchorPoint.
colorizedCostumes
Array of costumes that avatar is currently wearing, with their color/texture information.
mood
Name of current mood.
orientationName
Name of current orientation.
structure
The structure that the costumes will be displayed on.
URLRoot
This is prepended to the relative URLs to make an absolute URL for costume art, textures, etc.

Presentation()
Initializes colorizedCostumes to an empty Vector

addPosition(Position)
Adds the given position to the Presentation's vector of positions.
addPositionByName(String)
Looks for a position with the given name in the structure.
backmostRegistrationPoints(Vector)
Returns a vector of registration points, in back-to-front order.
clearPositions()
Empties the Presentation's vector of positions.
frontmostRegistrationPoints(Vector)
Returns a vector of registration points, in back-to-front order.
generateContainerSegments()
Returns an ordered list of ContainerSegments, which can then be used to generate registration points or ready-to-draw PresentationElements.
generatePresentationElements(Vector)
Given an ordered vector of ContainerSegments, returns an ordered vector of PresentationElements, with their imagePoints filled in.
getPositions()
Returns the Presentation's vector of positions.
returnContainerSegments(Vector)
Recycles some of the objects in containerSegments for later use.
returnRegistrationPoints(Vector)
Recycles the elements of registrationPoints for later use.
setPositions(Vector)
Replaces the Presentation's vector of positions.

anchorPoint 
  public RegistrationPoint anchorPoint
Name of registration point from which avatar is aligned with its background, and point in background on which to align this registration point in avatar.
anchorSegment 
  public String anchorSegment
Name of segment containing anchorPoint. This is an optimization; it could be found by searching all segments for a registration point with the right name.
orientationName 
  public String orientationName
Name of current orientation. Must be specified; a null value is illegal.
mood 
  public String mood
Name of current mood. May be unspecified; a null value chooses a default mood.
colorizedCostumes 
  public Vector colorizedCostumes
Array of costumes that avatar is currently wearing, with their color/texture information.
URLRoot 
  public String URLRoot
This is prepended to the relative URLs to make an absolute URL for costume art, textures, etc. It is not used by any of the methods in this class at this time; this is just a convenient place to store it for the clients who actually want to draw the art.
structure 
  public Structure structure
The structure that the costumes will be displayed on. Note that this is not necessarily the structure that the costumes were defined for.

Presentation 
  public Presentation()
Initializes colorizedCostumes to an empty Vector

returnContainerSegments 
  public static void returnContainerSegments(Vector containerSegments)
Recycles some of the objects in containerSegments for later use. This is an optimization for performance (minimizes garbage collection). You don't need to ever call this, but if you do, call it only when you are completely finished accessing any objects in containerSegments, including nested objects like registration points.
Parameters:
containerSegments - the vector returned from generateContainerSegments
See Also:
returnRegistrationPoints
returnRegistrationPoints 
  public static void returnRegistrationPoints(Vector registrationPoints)
Recycles the elements of registrationPoints for later use. This is an optimization for performance (minimizes garbage collection). You don't need to ever call this, but if you do, call it only when you are completely finished accessing any objects in registrationPoints
Parameters:
registrationPoints - a vector full of registration points such as the one returned from backmostRegistrationPoints or frontmostRegistrationPoints
See Also:
backmostRegistrationPoints, frontmostRegistrationPoints, returnContainerSegments
addPosition 
  public void addPosition(Position position)
Adds the given position to the Presentation's vector of positions.
See Also:
addPositionByName
addPositionByName 
  public Position addPositionByName(String positionName)
Looks for a position with the given name in the structure. If none is found in the structure, looks in the costumes. If a position is found, adds the position to the Presentation's vector of positions. If no matching position is found, returns null.
See Also:
addPosition
backmostRegistrationPoints 
  public Vector backmostRegistrationPoints(Vector segments)
Returns a vector of registration points, in back-to-front order. The registration points are from the backmost containerSegment for each structure segment.
See Also:
frontmostRegistrationPoints
clearPositions 
  public void clearPositions()
Empties the Presentation's vector of positions.
frontmostRegistrationPoints 
  public Vector frontmostRegistrationPoints(Vector segments)
Returns a vector of registration points, in back-to-front order. The registration points are from the frontmost containerSegment for each structure segment.
See Also:
backmostRegistrationPoints
generateContainerSegments 
  public Vector generateContainerSegments()
Returns an ordered list of ContainerSegments, which can then be used to generate registration points or ready-to-draw PresentationElements.
See Also:
ContainerSegment
generatePresentationElements 
  public Vector generatePresentationElements(Vector segments)
Given an ordered vector of ContainerSegments, returns an ordered vector of PresentationElements, with their imagePoints filled in. ImagePoints are set relative to the anchorPoint of the presentation.
getPositions 
  public Vector getPositions()
Returns the Presentation's vector of positions.
See Also:
addPosition
setPositions 
  public void setPositions(Vector newPositions)
Replaces the Presentation's vector of positions. It is more common to add positions one at a time. This method is typically reserved for save/restore situations.
See Also:
addPosition
